member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.SystemWeb.CompatibilityDataProtector
member.summary: A that can be used by ASP.NET 4.x to interact with ASP.NET Core's DataProtection stack. This type is for internal use only and shouldn't be directly used by developers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.SystemWeb.CompatibilityDataProtector.RunWithSuppressedPrimaryPurpose(System.Func{System.Object,System.Byte[],System.Byte[]},System.Object,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Invokes a delegate where calls to and will ignore the primary purpose and instead use only the sub-purposes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.SystemWeb.DataProtectionStartup
member.summary: Allows controlling the configuration of the ASP.NET Core Data Protection system.
member.remarks: Developers should not call these APIs directly. Instead, developers should subclass this type and override the method or methods as appropriate.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.SystemWeb.DataProtectionStartup.ConfigureServices(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection)
member.summary: Configures services used by the Data Protection system.
member.remarks: Developers may override this method to change the default behaviors of the Data Protection system.

member.remarks: Developers should generally override the method instead of this method.

member.summary: Provides a default implementation of required services, calls the developer's configuration overrides, then creates an .

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.SystemWeb.Resources.DataProtector_ProtectFailed
member.summary: A call to Protect failed. This most likely means that the data protection system is misconfigured. See the inner exception for more information.
